37 /*
38  * BYTE 0:
39  * Version Number (V): 3 bits
40  Specifies the SAP version. This field shall be set to 1.
41  Addsap_multicast_addrs Type (A): 1 bit
42  This bit shall be set to 0 to indicate that 32-bit IPv4 addsap_multicast_addrses are used.
43  Reserved (R): 1 bit
44  This bit shall be set to 0.
45  Message Type (T): 1 bit
46  This bit shall be set to 0 for session announcements and 1 for session deletions.
47  Encryption (E): 1 bit
48  SDP payload encryption shall not be used. This bit shall therefore be set to 0 for an unencrypted payload.
49  Compsap_multicast_addrsed (C): 1 bit
50  SDP payload compsap_multicast_addrsion shall not be used. This bit shall therefore be set to 0 for an uncompsap_multicast_addrsed payload
51  So te binary version is:
52  _ 00100000 thus 0x20 for announcement
53  _ 00100000 thus 0x24 for announcement
54 
55 */
56 #define SAP_header_announcement 0x20
57 #define SAP_header_deletion 0x24
58 /*
59  * BYTE 1:
60  * Authentication Length: 8 bits
61  * This shall be set to 0 in VIVOE as no authentication data is psap_multicast_addrent
62  */
63 #define SAP_header_AL 0x00
64 
65 /*
66  * BYTE 9 and more:
67  * Optional Payload Type:
68  * This is a ASCII text string followed by null character.
69  * this shall be set to "application/sdp"
70  */
71 #define SAP_header_OPT "application/sdp"
72 
73 /*
74  * After the really hard and scholar computation I have deduced that the total
75  * size of the header of the SAP is 24 bytes:
76  * byte 0 as described bedfore --> 1 byte
77  * Authentication Length: --> + 1 byte
78  * Message Identifier Hash: --> + 2 bytes
79  * Operating Source: --> + 4 bytes
80  * Optional Payload Type: --> + 16 bytes
81  * _____________
82  * Total: 24 bytes
83  */
84 #define SAP_header_size 24
85 #define SAP_header_OS_position 4
86 
87 
91 #define SAP_MAX_size 400
92 
96 struct {
97  struct sockaddr_in multicast_addr;
98  int udp_socket_fd;
99  int udp_socket_fd_rec;
100 }sap_socket;

105 void init_sap_multicast(){
106  int status = -1;
107 
108  g_debug("initializing SAP socket");
109 
110  memset(&sap_socket.multicast_addr, 0, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
111  sap_socket.multicast_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
112  sap_socket.multicast_addr.sin_port = htons(9875);
113  inet_aton("224.2.127.254", &sap_socket.multicast_addr.sin_addr);
114 
115  /* open UDP socket */
116  int udp_socket_fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
117  if ( udp_socket_fd == -1 ) {
118  g_critical("Failed to create UDP socket to send SAP/SDP announcement: %s\n",strerror(errno));
119  }
120  /* save value of socket into global structure */
121  sap_socket.udp_socket_fd = udp_socket_fd;
122 
123  /* open UDP socket */
124  udp_socket_fd = socket(AF_INET,SOCK_DGRAM , IPPROTO_UDP);
125  fcntl(udp_socket_fd, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
126  if ( udp_socket_fd == -1 ) {
127  g_critical("Failed to create UDP socket to send SAP/SDP announcement: %s\n",strerror(errno));
128  }
129  /* save value of socket into global structure */
130  sap_socket.udp_socket_fd_rec = udp_socket_fd;
131 
132  /* define a TTL of one, this will restrict the Multicast datagram to be restricted to the same subnet, which we want for VIVOE */
133  uint8_t ttl = 1;
134  setsockopt(sap_socket.udp_socket_fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_TTL, &ttl, sizeof(ttl));
135 
136  struct in_addr default_interface;
137  default_interface.s_addr = ethernetIfTable_head->ethernetIfIpAddress;
138  setsockopt (sap_socket.udp_socket_fd, IPPROTO_IP, IP_MULTICAST_IF, &default_interface, sizeof(default_interface));
139 
140  status = bind( sap_socket.udp_socket_fd_rec,
141  (struct sockaddr *)&(sap_socket.multicast_addr),
142  //sizeof(sap_socket.multicast_addr) );
143  sizeof( struct sockaddr_in));
144 
145  /* check for binding errors */
146  if ( status < 0 )
147  g_error("Failed to bind socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
148 
149 
150  struct ip_mreq imreq;
151  /* set content of struct saddr and imreq to zero */
152  memset(&imreq, 0, sizeof(struct ip_mreq));
153  imreq.imr_multiaddr.s_addr = inet_addr(sap_multi_addr); /* multicast group to join*/
154 
155  imreq.imr_interface.s_addr = ethernetIfTable_head->ethernetIfIpAddress; /* use DEFAULT interface */
156  /* JOIN multicast group on default interface - pass the ip_multicast_request to kernel */
157  status = setsockopt(sap_socket.udp_socket_fd_rec,
158  IPPROTO_IP,
159  IP_ADD_MEMBERSHIP,
160  (const void *)&imreq,
161  sizeof(struct ip_mreq) );
162 
163 
164 }

171 static const uint16_t build_MAI(int session_version){
172  /*
173  * the Message Identifier Hash should be derived from the session version number of the SDP message
174  * As the Session Version is a 32-bits integer and the MAI is only a 16-bits field, we have to take only
175  * a part of the Session Version, but has the session version shall be increased by 1 each time a new SDP
176  * message is created, we should reverberate this on the MAI. So we will take only the 16 LSB of the session version
177  */
178  return (char) (session_version & 0x00FF);
179 }
180 
186 static const in_addr_t build_OS(void){
187  /*
188  * VIVOE norm specifies that the field Operating Source of the SAP header should contain the IP of the Service Provider
189  * This IP is the IP of the Primary interface that we retrieve from the ethernetIfTable
190  */
191 
192  /* Primary interface is the head of the list of entries of ethernetIfTable */
193  return ethernetIfTable_head->ethernetIfIpAddress;
194 }
195 
201 static gboolean build_SAP_header(char *header, int session_version, gboolean deletion){
202  char returnv[SAP_header_size];
203  int offset = 0; /* an offset use to concatenate the arrays */
204 
205  if(deletion)
206  returnv[0] = SAP_header_deletion;
207  else
208  returnv[0] = SAP_header_announcement;
209  offset++;
210  returnv[1] = SAP_header_AL;
211  offset++;
212  uint16_t mhi = build_MAI(session_version);
213  memcpy(returnv+offset, &mhi, sizeof(uint16_t));
214  offset += sizeof(uint16_t);
215  in_addr_t operatig_source = build_OS();
216  memcpy(returnv+offset, &operatig_source, sizeof(uint32_t));
217  offset += sizeof(uint32_t);
218  memcpy(returnv+offset, SAP_header_OPT , sizeof(SAP_header_OPT)/sizeof(char) );
219  offset += sizeof(SAP_header_OPT)/sizeof(char);
220  memcpy( header,returnv,SAP_header_size );
221  return TRUE;
222 }
223 
231 static char* build_SAP_msg(struct channelTable_entry * entry, int *sap_msg_length, gboolean deletion){
232 
233  GstSDPMessage *msg;
234  /* create a new SDP message */
235  if (gst_sdp_message_new(&msg)){
236  g_critical("Failed to create SDP message\n");
237  return FALSE;
238  }
239 
240  /*
241  * build the SDP message
242  */
243  create_SDP(msg, entry);
244 
245  /* extract the randomly generated session_version integer */
246  const GstSDPOrigin *origin = gst_sdp_message_get_origin (msg);
247  int session_version = htonl(atoi(origin->sess_version));
248 
249  /* Build the header */
250  char header[SAP_header_size];
251  build_SAP_header(header, session_version, deletion);
252 
253  /* Build the *payload */
254  char *payload = g_strdup (gst_sdp_message_as_text(msg));
255 
256  /* concat header and payload */
257  int sap_msg_size = SAP_header_size+strlen(payload);
258  char *sap_msg = (char*) malloc(sap_msg_size*sizeof(char));
259  memcpy(sap_msg, header, SAP_header_size);
260  memcpy(sap_msg+SAP_header_size, payload, strlen(payload));
261  *sap_msg_length = sap_msg_size; // save the length if the message into sap_msg_length
262  free(payload);
263  return sap_msg;
264 }
265 
271 static char* SAP_depay(char* udp_payload){
272  /* set a pointer on the beginning of udp payload */
273  char *head = udp_payload;
274  head += SAP_header_size;
275  return head;
276 }
277 
283 gboolean prepare_socket(struct channelTable_entry * entry ){
284  /* create UDP payload and save the payload into sap_datas structure */
285  entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length = 0;
286  entry->sap_datas->udp_payload = build_SAP_msg(entry, &(entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length), FALSE); /* build SAP announcement message (not deletion message) */
287  /* for(int i = 0; i<entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length ; i++)
288  printf("%02X\t%d\n", entry->sap_datas->udp_payload[i], i); */
289  return TRUE;
290 }

298 gboolean send_announcement(gpointer entry){
299 
300  /* check channel status, this is check as a stop condition
301  * if the status in stop, we return false, which means that
302  * we will stop to call repeteadly create_SDP
303  */
304  int nb_bytes = -1;
305  struct channelTable_entry * channel_entry = entry;
306  if( channel_entry->channelStatus == channelStop ){
307  /* Build deletion packet */
308  channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload = build_SAP_msg(channel_entry, &(channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length), TRUE);
309  nb_bytes = sendto( sap_socket.udp_socket_fd,
310  channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload,
311  channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length,
312  0,
313  (struct sockaddr *) &(sap_socket.multicast_addr),
314  sizeof(sap_socket.multicast_addr));
315  return FALSE;
316  }else{
317  /* Send Annoucement message */
318  nb_bytes = sendto( sap_socket.udp_socket_fd,
319  channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload,
320  channel_entry->sap_datas->udp_payload_length,
321  0,
322  (struct sockaddr *) &(sap_socket.multicast_addr),
323  sizeof(sap_socket.multicast_addr));
324  }
325  /* check if the number of bytes send is -1, if so an error as occured */
326  if ( nb_bytes == -1 )
327  {
328  g_critical("Failed to send SAP/SDP announcement: %s",strerror(errno));
329  return FALSE;
330  }
331  return TRUE;
332 }
333 
338 gboolean receive_announcement(){
339  int status;
340  int udp_payload_length = SAP_MAX_size;
341 
342  char udp_payload[SAP_MAX_size];
343  status = read( sap_socket.udp_socket_fd_rec,
344  udp_payload,
345  udp_payload_length );
346 
347  if (status == -1)
348  {
349  g_critical("Failed to receive: %s\n", strerror(errno));
350  return TRUE;
351  }
352  else if ( status == sizeof(udp_payload ))
353  {
354  g_warning("datagram too large for buffer: truncated");
355  return TRUE;
356  }
357  else
358  {
359  /* compare the payloed read on the socket with the payload read before
360  * if there different, save the new payload into the sap_dat of the channel
361  */
362  /* check if it is the one we should be listening to */
363  unsigned char *sdp_msg = (unsigned char*) SAP_depay(udp_payload);
364  /* struct to save the multicast IP of the receive stream */
365  in_addr_t multicast_addr;
366  char channel_desc[DisplayString64]; /* the maximum size of the channelDesc is 64 bytes */
367  GstCaps* caps = get_SDP(sdp_msg, status - SAP_header_size, &multicast_addr, channel_desc);
368 
369  /* if caps are null, a problem occured or this is not a SAP/SDP announcement from the right channel */
370  if(caps == NULL )
371  return TRUE; /* we cannot return FALSE, cause we need to keep on listenning for our SAP/SDP annoucement */
372 
373  struct channelTable_entry* iterator = channelTable_SU_head;
374  while (iterator != NULL )
375  {
376  if (iterator->channelReceiveIpAddress == multicast_addr)
377  {
378  /* Now we are sure that this is our SAP/SDP annoucement */
379  /* check if the SAP message is a deletion message */
380  if( udp_payload[0] == SAP_header_deletion ){
381  delete_steaming_data(iterator); /* delet streaming has it is stopped */
382  }
383  else
384  {
385  stream_data *data = iterator->stream_datas;
386  /*
387  * If pipeline is not created yet, create it and start to display the stream
388  */
389  if ( data == NULL )
390  {
391  if ( !init_stream_SU ( caps, iterator ) )
392  start_streaming ( iterator->stream_datas, iterator->channelVideoFormatIndex );
393  /* init the video channelUserDesc field */
394  iterator->channelUserDesc = strdup( (const char*) channel_desc);
395  iterator->channelUserDesc_len = strlen(channel_desc);
396  }
397  /*
398  * otherwise, replace udpsrc element's caps with the caps extracted from SDP file
399  */
400  else
401  {
402  GstCaps *current_caps;
403  g_object_get ( G_OBJECT ( data->udp_elem ) , "caps" , &current_caps , NULL ) ;
404  if ( ! gst_caps_is_equal ( caps, current_caps ) ){
405  gst_element_set_state (data->pipeline, GST_STATE_NULL ) ;
406  set_udpsrc_param( data->udp_elem , iterator , caps ) ;
407  update_channelTable_entry_roi_from_caps ( iterator , caps ) ;
408  gst_element_set_state (data->pipeline, GST_STATE_PLAYING);
409  }
410  }
411 
412  }
413  }
414  iterator = iterator->next_SU;
415  }
416  return TRUE;
417  }
418 }
